Reviews.Title: “Perfect. Period.”
Reviews.Author: mtl-vt-itl
Reviews.Content: I have travelled around the world and have been fortunate enough to stay in some of the finest hotels ... and I would rank this among them. It is small, it is quiet, the staff is discrete and pleasant, it is central, clean... in short, quite perfect. Not inexpensive, but by Roman (and Hassler) standards, not breaking the bank either. Thanks very much for a quick, perfect layover. Karen, Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: b9mccaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Il Palazzetto #4, which is on the 4th floor with easy access to the rooftop balcony overlooking the Spanish Steps. Ask for room #4 if you stay here! There are only 3 other rooms in the hotel (Il Palazzetto is an offshoot of Hassler Hotel across the street), and we were the only ones staying there in late February. All three desk attendants at Il Palazzetto were friendly and helpful with reservations/directions, etc. The breakfast buffet at the Hassler Hotel was excellent, and although our reservation suggested continental breakfast, they had no problem with us participating in the full breakfast each day. We highly recommend Il Palazzetto!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Justonemoreholiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in room 2 overlooking the Spanish Steps. Our room was very clean and serviced twice a day so we always had warm, dry towels. The staff were excellent, especially Daniella on reception, and couldn't do enough to help us. Breakfast, included in the room rate, was at the nearby Hassler hotel and you had a couple of minutes walk outside to get there which is not a problem even in the rain in February. If you like a hotel with lots of amenities, food and drink, then this hotel is not for you. If however you enjoy exclusivity, personal service, location and value inteh centre of Rome, book here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Singapore_Fish
Reviews.Content: Four nights in room 2 in late October. Quick although somewhat formal check in at hotel Hassler, but very welcoming host at Il Palazzetto and fantastic location for first time visitor to Rome. Great thing about this place for us was it was super quiet even though the Spanish Steps are mere meters away, also the feeling of being in a small boutique apartment rather than a big hotel chain. Expensive but excellent breakfast in a terrific room setting in Hassler. Eye wateringly expensive to book a guide through the Hotel, but a good way to skip the queues and make the most of your investment to get there in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Seattle98101
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in Room 2 at Il Palazzetto, and it was wonderful. A bit more expensive than other options but Rome isn't cheap, and it was worth it to have a really spectacular end to our Italian vacation. Check-in at the nearby Hassler was handled quickly and graciously, and we were escorted to our room while a bellman followed with our bags. There is also a reception desk on the ground floor of Il Palazzetto, staffed until 11 pm, where we could leave our room key when departing that way, as well as get help with dinner reservations, etc. although they don't handle cash or checkin/out there. Very friendly and personal service, since they are looking after only four rooms. The room was gorgeous, with a view onto the Spanish Steps but very quiet. Great bed, walk-in closet with plenty of hangers and drawers, large bathroom with a tub and separate glass-doored shower, a decent hairdryer, and twice-daily maid service. We requested extra pillows and an iron/ironing board which were both supplied promptly. Breakfast at the Hassler was good - in addition to the usual juices, yogurt, cereals, breads & pastries, and meats/cheeses, there was a nice assortment of sliced fresh fruit, eggs (soft-boiled and scrambled), bacon & sausage, and pancakes. Service here was efficient if impersonal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room in a fantastic setting”
Reviews.Author: EinarOrn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Il Palazzetto for two nights in August 2010. The setting is amazing, and the room was great. The breakfast at the Hassler was fantastic. We and my fiance were extremely happy with our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Angeline C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Il Palazzetto for the last 2 nights of a 2 1/2 week trip. On arrival we had stayed at the Splendide Royal up near the Borghese Gardens and wanted to experience a smaller property to see out our last days in Rome. This property really is something VERY special. It's location right on the Spanish Steps is breath taking and there is nothing like watching the sun set from the roof terrace wine bar as tired and hot tourists navigate the steps! We stayed in Room 4 which is on the top floor and although it is incredibly close to the roof terrace bar the sound insulation is incredible! To have the use of the facilities and concierge services at The Hassler was perfect and we were welcomed as if we were guests there. The breakfast was wonderful, note that a Continental breakfast is included in the room rate. Our only gripe was the restaurant recommendation.When we arrived it held great promise as we were welcomed by walls lined with photos of famous celebrities who have dined there, so you'd think the food would be good right? WRONG! We had better meals at more local restaurants where we were the only non-Romans! We had said to the concierge that we wanted a really local place but sadly this was very over priced for below average food. On our last night we enjoyed a delicious meal on a roof terrace surrounded by locals and didn't want to leave! Il Palazzetto is wonderfully located for walking the length and breadth of Rome and with it's links to The Hassler, you really can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: GarJarvis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Il Palazzetto in October for our honeymoon. The hotel only has three rooms so they make sure they are kept perfectly. It afforded great privacy and a sense of luxury for a reasonable price. Breakfast each morning at the Hassler was always excellent. The roof top bar is a perfect place to people watch with a cocktail. Location wise you could not ask for better to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “A great alternative”
Reviews.Author: McLee58
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at Il Palazzetto on the recommendation of a friend who had also stayed there. As other reviews state , this small boutique hotel is owned by the prestigious Hassler Hotel located nearby. Having stayed in many 5 star hotels , I thought this was a great alternative. We requested , and were given apartment 4 which is effectively on the top floor - on the same floor as the restaurant and under the rooftop bar. I will come back to that later. Check in was at the Hassler and was seamless. The Hassler is located at the top of the Spanise steps on one side , whilst this hotel is located at the top of the Spanish Steps on the other side. It is a walk of about 50m. The room was the size of large standard room of any 5 star hotel. It was absolutely spotless clean , had a walk in robe , plenty of hanging space and a bathroom of very generous proportions , including a large bath and separate shower . The bed was very big and comfortable and the room was cleaned and towels changed twice per day. There was a table and chairs with windows opening with a terrific view of the Spanish Steps . You walked out of our room , up several steps , to an outdoor restaurant. The staff there were always friendly and even though we did not eat at that restaurant , they were always courteous and friendly towards us as we would walk past several tables and then up another flight of steps to the rooftop exit ( where there was also a bar ) and then out onto the top of the Spanish Steps. Exiting this way was much easier than getting the lift down to ground level and then walking a circuitous route. The rooftop bar only opens at 5pm and is a great place to chill out at the end of the day. It is not cheap for a drink as a standard beer was 9 Euros. The bar is open until around midnight. I was concerned that there may have been a ot of noise from the restaurant and bar filtering into our room at night but was pleasantly surprised that this was not the case. The only noise I heard one night was when the rooftop bar was being cleaned after closing and there was a sound of chairs being dragged across the floor. That only happened on one night. As it was so hot , we had to sleep with the windows closed and the air conditioning on. The room felt like it was soundproofed and the air con was extremely efficient. Breakfast was at The Hassler and included in our room rate of about $350 Euros per night. It was a standard continental breakfast . Beware if you ask for anything cooked , you will be charged up to 20 Euros. There are complimentary pushbikes and one day we cycled around the nearby park which was a great way to spend several hours. The hotel is very centrally located and is walking distance to most of the attractions and some great restaurants - not to mention the shopping. Before coming to Rome , we had been in Positano and Capri where the hotels cost double that of Il Palazzetto and as such , I thought it represented great value for money. I found the staff at The Hassler to be friendly and courteous as well and certainly do not agree with some of the comments expressed in other reviews. Would I stay in this hotel again - undoubtedly yes. It is a great alternative to your traditional large 5 star hotel , which I think can be quite impersonal. If possible , I would suggest you ask for room 4 as this is the only room on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, but Will Not Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: cg0994
Reviews.Content: We returned last month from our amazing 16 night trip to Italy. Our home for our last 2 nights of this trip was il Palazzetto. Check-in at the Hassler Hotel (the sister property, where you check in if you are staying at il Palazzetto) was smooth, and we were shown Room 1, a nice sized room with a view overlooking the Spanish Steps. The becolumned decor was luxurious, featuring a spacious armoire stuffed with amenities at the foot of the enormous and comfortable bed, big bathtub and separate glass-doored shower. We had breakfast at the Hassler, which is included with the room when you stay at Il Palazzetto. The Hassler is pretty fancy, and the service inattentive, bordering on snobbish, a big change after all the enthusiastic service throughout Umbria and Tuscany on this trip, but breakfast itself was fine. At some point on our second day, we made the mistake of trying to print out our boarding passes at the Hassler. We had asked the front desk at the Palazzetto how to get our boarding passes printed, and she said to go to the Hassler's concierge, and he would print them for us. Not so, as all he was willing to do was point us to the main desk to ask for a key to the business center. The "business center" turned out to be a closet with two computers and a printer, which, we discovered upon trying to print, was out of black ink! After first calling back down to the front desk, then my husband actually GOING back to the front desk, they told us in their perfect English that a technician would be coming by to resolve the issue. The man they sent, though, spoke no English, and was NOT a technician of any sort we could determine. He spent some considerable time randomly clicking around in Windows, as if to discover the root of our problem, while the print queue (and the printer itself) flashed the answer at him in his own language! Sadly, we didn't know how to say "black ink cartridge" in any way that made sense to him, and he couldn't, ultimately, help us! So we went BACK to the front desk, where THEY were unable to print out our boarding passes, because, on the airline's website, it thought they'd already been printed!!! We walked away with no boarding passes. It was very frustrating, and between the indifferent attitude and the incompetence, we will not stay there again. (As far as we know, the legendary Hassler Hotel, favored stay for world leaders and movie stars, at the top of the Spanish Stairs since the 1800s, still has no black ink in their printer. Good luck.) While in Rome we visited the main sites, and ate at two very good restaurants, Sangallo and La Tavernetta. We’ve done an entire day-by-day trip report which give a lot more information about the towns and restaurants we visited (most of them in Southern Tuscany and Northern Umbria), which you can see here: http://willtravelforfoodandwine.blogspot.com/

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: mjjhawkins
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in room number 4. The room was beautiful, very spacious and had a fantastic view of the Spanish Steps. We were given a very warm welcome by the staff, particularly by Beate who did the check-in for us. Breakfast at the Hassler was a lovely experience. Overall a thoroughly enjoyable stay. Having an aperitivo in Palazzetto's "secret garden" is a must (most nights from around 7pm).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: yangky_5
Reviews.Content: We split our stay between the hotel Hassler and the Il Palazzetto during this trip. The Hotel Hassler was impressive, and the service was excellent. The best thing about the Il Palazzetto for me was that one evening, we decided to eat in the restaurant and we opened a bottle of wine (prices of wine here are very good) since we could not finish it at the table, they let us take the wine and the glasses to our room and finish it there at our leisure. The window opens right to the Spanish steps. You could literally set up a camera in the room, go to the Steps, click on the remote to shoot pictures of you in the steps from your room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It's a very homey hotel in a great location. Only downside was that you have to share the elevator with the food service of the restarant upstairs and it gets difficult to get the elevator during a function. Otherwise, we loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: WatsonTravellers
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most fantastic stays we've ever had. First, the location could not be beat. It is literally at the top of the Spanish steps. Adjacent to a busy train station, you can enter the front door on a side pedestrian way. During the evening hours when the front is all locked up you walk through a very chic bar (with fantastic drinks) and enter your room that way. A few steps past the church at the top of the Spanish steps is The Hotel Hassler. At our stay we had breakfast every morning included at the Hassler in a lovely courtyard. The Hassler is classic and posh - not somewhere I'd favor staying- which made it perfect to visit and sleep in the more modern less stuffy Il Palazetto. Since our stay was in August, we actually had to check-in at the Hassler and use their concierge services because the wine school and front desks in Il Palazetto were closed for August. This wasn't a problem at all since The Hassler was so close by. The bars in both hotels are beautiful in your own right (you can get on the roof of the Hassler for a great view of Rome). The room in Il Palazetto was amazing. Spacious, plush, plush bed. Great tub. The window in our bathroom overlooked a side area on the Spanish steps. You could hear the heartbeat of the city if you wanted or close it if you wanted. It was so fun to sit on the steps and be part of the action but even nicer to sit in Il Palazetto bar and people watch. Stay here! We got an amazing deal in August! The desks and wine school weren't staffed but the maids made up the rooms every day. With only 8 rooms, this is truly a hidden gem. We couldn't have asked for a more romantic getaway in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Savoring the sunset and a glass of vino on the Spanish steps”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodRob
Reviews.Content: An island of tranquility and elegance overlooking the Spanish Steps, Il Palazzetto's 18th-century landmark terrace is one of the world’s best places to imbibe a robust Italian wine. The view, with a Roman sunset for a backdrop, is absurdly faultless. The wine list, with a choice of more than 400 bottles, shows care and flair in every country and every region, offering some of Italy’s best bottles at fair prices. The restrained, competent service staff look like Prada models, offering a changing list of a dozen wines by the glass for entry-level oenophiles. Check out the Italian cocktail hour with an exquisite selection of sumptuous snacks to accompany the pure, crisp taste of your Orvieto.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem is right!!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust5
Reviews.Content: A little late in writing this review (by almost 2 years!), but we are planning another trip back to Italy this summer with one night in Rome and of course I was reminded of our last stay at this incredible hotel. Gorgeous room, gorgeous bathroom, luxurious linens, breakfast at the Hassler. But what truly made it special was its location: not overlooking or near the Spanish Steps, but practically ON the Spanish Steps! And no, noise was not an issue. You have only to close the window and all sound is blocked. This was possibly one of our best and most memorable hotel stays ever.

Reviews.Title: “The coolest location imaginable!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestScott
Reviews.Content: This is a truely great find in Rome! I almost kept it from Tripadvisor. Stay here and you will be amazed at your good fortune. Room #4 overlooks the Spanish steps the room is elegant and the neighborhood very good for walking to the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room but very disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: NCH01
Reviews.Content: Overall I would say that our stay was disappointing and that is mostly due to the poor service received by the Palazetto staff. We arrived a late (after 11.30pm) and as mentionned in the email confirming my reservation, we went straight to the Hassler to check in. We were greeted by Manuel who was charming, welcoming and very helpful. He took us to our room and made many excellent suggestions as to where to go for a drink and where to go for dinner the next day. All very positive. The room was fine, nicely appointed but no view but that was made clear at the time of booking so no complaint there. Our issues were really when we tried to ask the Palazzetto staff anything - e.g. recommendation for a restaurant: they could only be bothered to recommend a couple of abvious ones and in very touristic locations which is exactly what we did not want. The very annoying part came at check out. We left our room on the third floor and took all our luggage to the reception to be told that we could not check out at the palazzetto and check in and check out were only at the Hassler. When I questionned this and said they should have told us earlier, the lady at reception then replied very aggressively that it was in the confirmation email I received (I checked and it was not) and that it was very clearly stated on the 2 pages of hotel information left in our room and it was really our fault and we should have read all the information received (!). Now ,we are on a weekend break with lots to see and do and I do not spend my spare time reading an A4 sheet of paper left somewhere in the room. What we especially disliked was the aggressive and patronizing tone used by this lady and the way she kept arguing with us, including with my boyfriend once I had gone all the way up to the Hassler to settle the bill. Clearly this is not a behaviour I expect or find acceptable in a hotel of such standard. This was made even more confusing when the charming staff at the Hassler told me I could have checked out at the Palazzetto... All in all, very disappointing attitude and we will not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JohnASeattle
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Il Palazzetto at the Spanish Steps in Rome. This hotel is owned by the nearby (two blocks away at the top of the Spanish Steps) Hotel Hassler. The four rooms are all similar in size, decor, and furnishings—the are all top notch! Try to get one of the two rooms that face the Steps on the third (?) level. Although right on the Steps the rooms are surprisingly VERY quite. There is one room on the top floor but that may be problematic due to its proximity to the restaurant (more on that latter). The room are very luxurious and have all the usual accoutrements. The walk in closet was a nice touch and the bathroom was spacious as was the bedroom. Included in our room price was breakfast at the nearby Hotel Hassler which was great. The staffs at both hotels were gracious and accommodating. There are complementary appetizers at the restaurant on the roof of the hotel. Very good with nice wines and wonderful view of the city of Rome laid out before you. We had dinner one night at the hotel. Overpriced and food was only so so. This is a restaurant that highlights their “wines” and has a very good, and expensive, wine list. They tried to serve a wine that was different than what was on the list when we had dinner. I was willing to pay the slightly inflated price for the older vintage listed. We the wine arrived it was the current vintage and was never informed of the change by the wait staff. I refused the bottle before it was opened and order another less expensive but equally wonderful bottle of Italian wine. However, upon check out the restaurant had charged me for the more expensive bottle, which was removed after discussion with the desk clerk at the Hassler. I will return to the hotel when back in Rome. Great location with nice size rooms and excellent staff. Forget the restaurant (except for a glass of wine with the free appetizers on the roof in the evening looking out on the city) overpriced with plus/minus food. To many other wonderful places nearby that are better for less money. That said, Il Palazzetto is a great choice when in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BrianGorman
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Il Palazzetto for 3 days at the end of a 6 week around the world trip. Our daughters had one room and we had the other. Rooms 1 and 3, which were very comfortable and beautifully decorated. The staff were all very helpful and every morning we had a lovely breakfast at the Hassler Hotel, just up from Il Palazzeto at the top of the Spanish Steps. Unfortunately the restaurant at Il Palazzeto was closed for the August holidays, but we were still able to enjoy a drink on the rooftop bar and terrace. This was truly an experience in relaxed indulgence. Sitting up on the terrace in the early evening, sipping my Campari and soda and watching the crowds exporing the Spanish Steps below. I had the whole terrace to myself for most of the time and sat on the comfy red upholstered cussions along the marble parapet and soaked in the atmosphere. (sigh....). It was a blissful way to cap off a day of exploring Rome. My only word of warning is about catching taxi's from or to the Hotel Hassler. I imagine that once you tell a taxi driver that your destination is that hotel, they decide to see how much money they can get out of you. On the trip from the train station to the hotel we were charged 30 euro. Upon reaching the hotel, the driver let us off on the other side of the road from the hotel, rather than dropping us off at the entry. The hotel staff told me that he did that because they want to avoid the scruitiny of the doorman as the fare should have been around 15 euro. On a trip from the hotel to Campidoglio, the driver did the old trick of switching a smaller note for a bigger one. For a 13 euro fare I gave him a 20 euro note, asking for a 5 back. As I looked away to collect my bag, he said I had only given him a 5 euro note, which he held up to me. I wasn't in for an arguement with an italian taxi driver and wasn't completely sure that I hadn't made this mistake he said I had made. So I just gritted my teeth and paid him the rest. That was the only negative experience I had in Rome and it didn't affect my overall postitive experience of the city and of Il Palazzetto. One last point to mention. They were working on the plumbing at Il Palazzetto during our stay and we did have a few occasions where we did not have either cold or hot water, mostly in the afternoon. As compensation we were granted our request to use the shower facilities at the Hassler Spa the evening of the day we checked out. This was prior to our 24 hour plane trip back to Sydney and made such a difference to us. The Hassler staff was very accommodating and we were given as much time as we needed to freshen up. I'd recommend Il Palazetto to anyone who might want to spend a bit extra to make themselved truly comfortable during their stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location & service!!!”
Reviews.Author: thetwomcs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Il Palazzetto for two nights 3-5th Aug as part of a trip around Europe. The location of the hotel is wonderful!! Our room (# 3) overlooked the Spanish steps and was decorated to the highest standard. Our 9 year old son was staying in the room with us and the hotel made up a comfortable single bed for him, which still left lots of room in the room. It was my husband’s birthday on 3rd and the receptionist must have spotted this when she took a copy of my husband’s passport, as a complimentary bottle of wine was in our room with a best wishes note when we returned from dinner – what attention to detail!! The service was impeccable and the taster menu at Il Palazzetto was incredible. The cocktail bar at the top of the hotel has great views and whilst a bit pricey, was well worth it. Breakfast is at the Hassler which is literally a 3min walk away. The staff at the Hassler were fantastic - so polite and helpful and when we returned from our trip (2 weeks later) held our bags for us so that we could spend a further day exploring Rome. One of the best service experiences we had on the whole trip - we would highly recommend Il Palazzetto 

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room, Great Location, Second Rate Service”
Reviews.Author: demi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights while in Rome. This hotel is affiliated with the Hotel Hassler, one of Rome’s nicest and most expensive hotels, but we were able to stay at Il Palazzetto and get what I assumed to be comparable service, at a little bit more affordable price. We stayed in one of the rooms looking out to the Spanish Steps. It doesn’t really overlook the Steps, but just kind of looks directly out to the Steps at eye level. The room was enormous and beautifully decorated. The bathroom had a lovely, large bathtub, as well as a stand-up shower. The bathroom was stocked with shampoo, lotion, and bubble bath, but only 1 bar of soap for the sink. Our bathroom also had a window overlooking a side street, and it was nice to open that window and let some cool air in and listen to the hustle and bustle of Rome while relaxing in the bathtub. The main room had a large bed that was very comfortable, and a nice flat screen television. There was plenty of space to store our luggage and also walk around the room without bumping into things. We were not able to control the heat, and the room got really warm at times. Not a huge problem, we would just throw open the windows. When the windows are open, it is noisy from all the people on the Steps. So, if you want to sleep, keep the windows and the shutters closed! We also heard lots of noise from the staff upstairs in the morning cleaning the rooftop terrace and generally getting ready to start the day. The sounds start early in the morning and are basically heavy chairs and tables being dragged across the floor, which echo down into the rooms. You will hear this noise throughout the day from people eating on the terrace, but we never had any issues at night. Of course, we never got back to our room until midnight or later, so I can’t really say what the noise level is like in the mid to late evening. The noise didn’t bother me too much, I would just put in my ear plugs when it would start up in the morning, and I could keep sleeping. But, be prepared. Breakfast was over at the Hotel Hassler every morning. Our 1st morning, we ordered our cappuccinos, and headed up to the buffet tables for eggs, baked goods, cheeses, meats, fruit, etc. To our surprise, we were handed a bill for 80 Euro! 40 Euro per person they charge for this breakfast buffet. We called our server over and questioned about breakfast being included with our room rate. Turns out –only baked goods (no fruit, nothing hot) are included with the Il Palazzetto room rate. Not one member of the hotel staff ever discussed this with us before until this incident happened. When we entered the main dining room, they have all the breakfast foods mixed together on 2 different tables, so we had no idea. We thought it was just a general buffet, and that we were free to eat whatever was available. They did end up taking care of the bill, and at that time explained to us that we were allowed baked goods only with the room rate. We were very disappointed with this news! I’ve read other reviews on this site that discuss all the items available for breakfast, and so I’m thinking that maybe they just recently made the change for the Il Palazzeto guests to not have the entire breakfast buffet included with their room? This is very disappointing. Our room did not come with direct access to the Internet as advertised. We were told that if we wanted to use the Internet, we could do so in the business center of the Hotel Hassler. We never inquired about this again, but their website does state that each room is equipped with ‘direct access to the Internet”. We weren’t provided with that, but maybe that comes down to the lack of communication on their part again? The staff working the front desk was friendly. However, they were not able to provide us with good information on places to eat and drink in the area. We asked for recommendations of enotecas, and we were given information that there was one down the street about 2 blocks, but they didn’t know the name of it. Oh well, we found many delicious places to eat and drink on our own in the area. It’s Rome, after all! Big umbrellas are available in the lobby to guests, and that was a nice touch. The staff at Hotel Hassler was stuffy. I guess that is to be expected. Overall, we really did enjoy our stay at Il Palazzetto, but I think that the communication and service from the hotel staff could be improved. This never put a damper on our trip, but for the amount of money spent on a room and the affiliation with Hotel Hassler, we expected much more. We would probably consider staying here again because the room was so spacious, and the location was wonderful, but we would just have to settle on lowering our expectations of the staff and general amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Orm-1
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 5 nights at this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. It is great value for money as we paid half the price it would cost to stay at the Hassler but we enjoyed all the facilities of the Hassler, such as a very pleasant breakfast each morning (included in our rate & you don't have to walk far, just across the road) and the services of the concierge and best of all, dining at Imagio's with its fantastic views of the city. We also dined at Il Palazzetto where we sampled white truffles for the first time and found out later that Anzo the chef spent time training with Gordon Ramsay. The food was excellent but the restaurant sadly lacks atmosphere as we were the only one's there. Maybe gets busy in Summer. The location is outstanding, could not be any more central for shopping, sites, metro, we walked everywhere and took the metro when it rained which is really easy to use. Our view from the room (Room 4) is just the best - looking out on to the famous Spanish Steps, what better view can you wish for when in Rome? The staff are very friendly and do everything to please which made our stay even more enjoyable. The room had character, was spacious enough and the bathroom was large with a bath and separate shower (limited toiletries so remember and bring your own) they don't provide complimentary water either. This was our first visit to Rome and we can't wait to come back and yes we will be choosing Il Palazzetto again. Fantastic value for money and great location and cosy room. 9/10 from us.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: HappyHoliday28
Reviews.Content: I booked this for a romantic weekend for my boyfriend's birthday present and it didn't disappoint. It is literally RIGHT next to the Spanish steps, and amazingly reasonable for the location. The room we stayed in was really big, and elegantly decorated and although it didn't have a totally clear view of the Steps, we could see them from the window. According to Mr and Mrs Smith, the website we booked through, one of the other rooms has a better view, but we were more than happy. The bathroom has a shower and a bath and is huge. The staff were really welcoming and made us feel special. They only have 3-4 rooms, so I guess that everyone gets that welcome! They leave a delicious bottle of wine in your room, and I understand you can do tastings there as well if you want. The restaurant is supposed to be amazing, but we were only there for 2 days so didn't have a chance to eat there. It overlooks the Spanish steps though. Breakfast is in another hotel at the top of the steps, and is a classic huge hotel buffet, with pancakes, fruit, pastries, fried brekkie, everything you would expect, done to a reasonable level.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return...great staff/room/location.”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine33
Reviews.Content: We began our honeymoon in Rome and Il Palazzetto was our first stop. We stayed for 3 nights and the room wasn't huge but very nice and clean. The bathroom was updated and large. We had a great view of the Spanish Steps and use of the Hassler's daily breakfast. The Hassler breakfast was the best we had during our 12 day stay in Italy. The staff at Il Palazzetto and at the Hassler were professional and friendly. The location at the Palazzetto was ideal...we walked everywhere...ancient Rome, Vatican, shopping, restaurants. If we are in Rome again, we will book here.

Reviews.Title: “Shut Out Our Last Night”
Reviews.Author: jpyoung
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for one night on our last night of a 16-day romantic Italian getaway before flying out of Rome. We wanted to splurge on our last night, and while we couldn't afford the Hassler, we could afford it's smaller sister hotel next door, Il Palazzetto, which sounded perfect for us, as it overlooked the Spanish Steps, had a terrace to sip wine on, and seemed, based on the website and reviewers' photos, quite luxurious. However, upon arriving at the Hassler for check in after a frustrating four-hour drive from Tuscany into hectic Rome and much in need of R&R, we were stunned to hear that despite our confirmed reservation, our room at the Il Palazzetto was not available due to a plumbing problem. Instead of being provided lodging at the Hassler, as one would assume, we were told that there was no room at the Hassler for us. However, they could put us up across the street at the Scalinata di Spagna, a small hotel we were unfamiliar with. Best of all, they said that they would comp us for the room charge. While we were disappointed with this news, as we were greatly looking forward to our stay at Il Palazzetto, it sounded fair considering that the room was free. We had little option but to accept the offer. Unfortunately, the room at the Scalinata was dirty, dingy, and reeked horribly of cheap perfume, perhaps from some type of carpet deodorizer to mask the smell. We tried airing the room out but it was futile. This is not somewhere we would have ever chosen, even at a great rate, and clearly it was not comparable to Il Palazzetto. Yes, the Scalinata had a semi-private terrace with a rooftop view of St. Peters in the distance, but we weren't sleeping on the terrace but in a dirty, smelly, tacky room. So while it was free, it still came at a price: our comfort and enjoyment. Again, we were willing to pay for comfortable accommodations, but the Hassler seemed more concerned with dumping us somewhere to solve their problem than making sure its guests' needs were met. We were looking for more than a place to sleep. We were looking for a four-star experience. On a side note, The Il Palazzetto offered to honor our complimentary breakfast at the Hassler, which unfortunately we could not enjoy, as we had to fly too early the next morning. The Hassler's room manager also offered to upgrade us from Il Palazzetto to the Hassler the next time were visiting Rome, but as it took us years to save for this trip and we live so far away, I'd be surprised if the hotel will actually honor this upgrade should we return some day. While these offers were appreciated, I'm not sure I'd want to book with them again, given this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: independanttravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the amazing Il Palazetto which is the sister hotel to the Hassler. Unbelievable room and staff so friendly and helpful. Our room had 4 large windows, all overlooking the Spanish Steps - gorgeous! We were unsure what to expect from the Hassler as you need to check in there and breakfast there too, and we had read mixed reviews. It was a wonderful experience. Fabulous hotel, we were made to feel very special, great food - particularly special are the cocktails on the roof terrace at Il Palazetto (though expensive) and dinner at the hotel - amazing tasting menu. The only downside with the Hassler is that the terrace where they serve breakfast was quite cold and a number of people complained. However, this did in no way spoil our experience - or our meals! A real treat of a place in a wonderful location - best in Roma!

Reviews.Title: “my own place next to the spanish steps”
Reviews.Author: travelloveraus
Reviews.Content: this is part of The Hassler at half the price only 4 rooms we stayed in one facing the spanish steps not at all noisy - great soundproofing beautiful room - toileteries own Hassler brand - gorgeous ! wonderful luxurious bed, big tv with lots of channels, fluffy bathrobes and towels, there is a terrace that we didnt get to use as we only stayed overnight but it would have been lovely to have a drink in the evening and look out .... the staff were friendly and efficient and recommended a fabulous restaurant within walking distance. the location was perfect right next to metro station of espagna and the designer shops ......... breakfast was at the Hassler just off the foyer as the breakfast room wasnt open yet but it was outstanding...at 6am as arranged "breakfast in a box."..this had everything and I do mean everything you could want except hot food....even great espresso coffee ! Nothing was too much trouble. The staff were very courteous and nothing was too much trouble. great value and really it felt like our own apartment yet we had access to one of the best hotels in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Great Start to a honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas526
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Its affiliation with the Hassler makes it all the more superb! The people at both the Hassler and the Palazetto were great! Very friendly and knowledgeable about where to go and what restuarants to go to. The room was the best room I had ever seen/stayed in in Europe. We would definitely stay here again the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at your fingertips BUT....”
Reviews.Author: LIZNewYork
Reviews.Content: I found Il Palazzetto online however, they do not have online booking. I was uncomfortable putting my credit card information in an email, so I had to call Italy to make my reservation. Unlike other hotels, this hotel has a 3 week cancellation policy. I agree with everything I have read on this site....the rooms are spacious, beautifully decorated and the breakfasts are delicious. The problem I had with the place was the entrance. It's on the side of the Spanish Steps and is actually the entrance to the restaurant. You need to walk through the restaurant to get to our room. At night when the restaurant is closed, there are people still hanging around the entrance. You must ring an intercom to get in. I didn't really feel that safe. Luckily, I was only staying one night and my room was not on the main floor. This hotel is tough to rate. It has all the amenities, is in a great location but the ackwardness of the entrance, the noise and the unsavory peddlers will make me think twice about this hotel for my next visit to Rome BTW, the bellhop took a very long time to get our bags from our room to the cab waiting infront of The Hassler. Good thing our flight was delayed!

Reviews.Title: “Seclusion right in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: jgodic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at il Palazzetto for 3 nights with my boyfriend. I was a little nervous that the hotel wouldn't live up to the price tag, but it did in every respect. The room was big, with a wonderful bathroom. The whole thing was done in neutrals, which was elegant without being boring. The location was perfect. Our room had a lovely view of the Spanish Steps. Noise wasn't an issue though since they had some amazingly light- and sound-proof shutters. They were so good that the first morning I woke up and thought it was still night even though it was 9am! The front desk staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. We sat on the terrace one afternoon and had a wonderful cheese plate and bottle of wine, enjoying the view over the steps and the sunshine. An unexpected bonus was the inclusion of the breakfast at the Hassler. This was hands-down the best breakfast i have ever had at a hotel, it was really a wonderful way to start the day! Rome is an expensive city to stay in from what I have gathered, and taking that into account I think il Palazzetto is a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Il palazetto was truly a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Travelling Mat
Reviews.Content: My wife booked Il Palazetto as a birthday treat and a treat it certainly was. We stayed for 4 days in August and had a superb time. The hotel was really well located for what we were in Rome to do. As we had not been before we had planned some serious sight seeing and we found that we could walk to all of the major locations within 30/40 minutes. Being right beside the Spanish steps we thought was ideal. Some people had suggested it could be quite noisy, we didn't find it so. The customer service we received whilst staying at the hotel was exemplary, from the House Manager Isabelle Chan through every member of staff we had the pleasure of engaging with. Whilst we did not eat in Il Palazetto's restaurant as it was closed during August, we did eat in the Panoramic restaurant at the Hassler where the food was excellent, and what a view!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it....but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: SAnderson30
Reviews.Content: Tough one this one! Il Palazzetto has a lot going for it - it's location is perfect, the rooms are spacious and very comfortably furnished and nicely decorated. We stayed in room 2 which is beautiful, and has a fantastic shower! The food is superb, and the choice of wine is amazing - though it would be it being a wine academy, but still, the quality is obvious. Another great thing going for Il Palazzetto is its affiliation with the Hotel Hassler. Make no mistake, the Hassler is a grand hotel, as grand as any, however, there is a very real warmth there. The staff I thought were excellent. The ladies that run the breakfast are delightful - very friendly, but a little cheeky with it which is great fun! The breakfast spread by the way is impressive - something for everyone from fruits and cereals to hot scrambled eggs and bacon. Yum! Giovanni on the front door will work tirelessly to get you a taxi, and again, is a real delight. Andrea in the lounge bar is great fun, and extremely friendly, but also excellent at his job - he should be treasured by this hotel as a credit to their industry - he makes wonderful effort on behalf of his guests. His bar colleagues too are first class. Now for the but, and its big! Il Palazzetto is extremely noisy! They have spent a fortune on keeping the outside noise down to almost zero with great windows and shutters, which are very necessary as the Spanish Steps are RIGHT outside and are crowded all day and night, but the inside of the building is made of marble, and the sound literally reverborates so that even a whisper on the ground floor, is like a scream by the time it reaches the rooms at the top. The staff are up and down the stairs all the time, and obviously have a chat as they go, but the resulting echo means that you will hear everything! The biggest problem however is the noise generated on the rooftop. The tables and chairs are cast iron, and at 7am the cleaning and waiting staff are preparing for their day, and these tables and chairs are dragged across the roof, and the noise that comes into the room is deafening. You will not sleep later than 7am for sure, and will not be able to go to bed until at least 10pm at night when again, the terraces are being cleaned, and the tables and chairs are being dragged. After long days on the hoof, your room is where you go for some quiet sanctuary, but this is not possible here, not at all. Saying that, if you don't plan to be in your room during these times, then this review shouldn't put you off. There is plenty to recommend about Il Palazzetto, and if not for the noise problem, I'd have rated it as excellent, but after a long year and a real need for relaxation, I did have a problem with not being able to sleep at least a little longer. PS - for tours of the city, try Through Eternity. Knowledgable for sure, but its more like being out with friends than a tour guide. I highly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Such a special place, right in the middle of the action!”
Reviews.Author: Schmabbit
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with our three month old baby and I have to say the staff of the Palazzetto and the Hassler were always on hand for help and advice. Service was extremely efficient and very friendly and personal, amazing considering how many guests go through the doors of the Hassler each day. The doorman even greeted our baby each morning using her name!. We loved this hotel and would now definatly stay there every time we are in Rome. The rooms were smart and had a great view of the Spanish steps, if you like absolute silence you may not like this as its full of hubbub at night but we liked it. The food in the restaurant of the Palazzetto is also great. The only thing I would advise if you have problems with getting about this probably would not suit you as there are a lot of steps, it also has a lift but it is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, if a little noisy!”
Reviews.Author: kazpalms
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights with my husband and two children (aged 12 and 8). We took two of the four rooms overlooking the Spanish steps. Wonderful situation but the Steps get very noisy, especially at night. The windows have excellent double glazing though. However when we stayed the air conditioning was switched off so it was a bit of a trade off between noise or fresh air! The rooms were lovely - large comfortable beds and luxury bathrooms (like others though, we felt they were a bit mean with the freebies! Only soap and shampoo provided. Would have been nice to see some body lotion/cotton wool etc). We had breakfast in what I think is the bar usually as the whole of the Hassler restaurant is under scaffolding and renovation. Don't know how long for - best to ask if you are going. We weren't informed of this prior to arrival so couldn't go for the meal there that we had wanted. Also, as the bar area is a bit small we rather annoyingly had to often wait for a table for breakfast or be offered one out in the rather less attractive lobby area. We found the staff very helpful - unlike some previous comments. The weekend concierge in particular was excellent with his suggestions for meals out and directions. He even managed to identify a pub for my husband to go and watch the Manchester United match in! All in all we really enjoyed our stay here but felt there are a few things they need to address - they should really inform people if their main restaurant is not open, prior to them arriving and they could provide better toiletries in the bathrooms for these prices. The breakfasts were lovely though, staff attentive and friendly and location perfect if a little noisy at times. My daughter did not want to come home and that, to me, is a measure of a place - when your children enjoy themselves as much as you do!

Reviews.Title: “Could've been better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Il Palazzetto is in a famous location at the Spanish Steps, although this means some noise throughout the day and night. The room we had was a decent size, but not large, with a luxury bathroom. The problem was that it smelled strange, frankly like a dirty diaper was hidden somewhere - we actually looked. I got dressed up (because how you dress is supremely important at the Hassler) and asked for a replacement room. After a few hours the answer came that they could move us to the main building - the next day. They tried to charge me the current walk-in price, hundreds more than the rate - about $250, I had paid well in advance for our palazzetto room. I wasn't going for that, so after another few hours they agreed to keep the original price for the main hotel room. That turned out to be an interior facing room, nice enough, and we were happy to be through with the front desk, who were civil but not dedicated to making things as perfect as their reputation would suggest. The Hassler is a beautiful looking hotel, but it is so formal that it would be a burden for most Americans who value service over stuffiness. I'm a businessman, dress relatively well, and am polite, had the money, but I didn't enjoy the sense of being assessed by the staff as to my station in life, and didn't get the sense of service or luxury the hotel's prices and attitude would lead one to expect.

Reviews.Title: “A special place”
Reviews.Author: london_traveller_007
Reviews.Content: Lovely, run by the Hassler, only 4 rooms so book early and ask for a room overlooking the Spanish Steps. The rooms are very elegant, well furnished with great linen (Irish linen pillow cases and I suspect Frett sheets - if these things matter!) No problems with soaps (unlike last poster) - in fact very generous huge Hassler soaps, and 2 large bottles of shampoo / bath foam. very good quality bath robes, slippers etc - everything you would expect - however, you don't get the other stuff you usually find in 5 satr hotels (lotions, mouth wash, ear buds, shoe shine etc). The position cannot get any better, you literally spill out onto the Spanish Steps (and all the shops and restaurants you can wish for)- there is also a private terrace where you can people watch. I think it's nicer staying here than at a large hotel. One moan which bothered me (but not my partner) - the doors are poorly insulated and you can hear people returning in the evening, foot steps, talking etc - pity - having invested in providing quality fittings to forget abt door insulation. Breakfast in summer in the Hassler Palm Court - great breakfasts and excellent, friendly service throughout - I will definitely stay here again - in fact whenever I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “More than just Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: ObservantGuest
Reviews.Content: Look out your window onto the Spanish steps. The room is large, comfortable, and everything is new. Breakfast at the rooftop restaurant in the Hassler Hotel has breathtaking views. Go out the entrance on the first floor of Il Palazzetto, and you're at the entrance to the subway. We appreciated the satellite TV with full SKY programming, although we only watched in the middle of the night after wandering the Rome streets. Only small problem was some slight neglect on service. They gave one bar of soap to serve for the sink, shower, and bidet. When we asked for more, it never came. The shower drain was clogged when we checked in, but after reporting it, they fixed it immediately. The price of 300 Euro per night is high, but compared to other places we saw at this rate, this is superior. We spent the first two nights of our honeymoon here, and it's definitely THE romantic spot to be in Rome.
